summary: This is a court order by Judge Alison J. Nathan granting a short continuance of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial from July 2021 to fall 2021. The continuance is granted due to the late filing of an S2 Superseding Indictment, which added new charges and an alleged victim, and due to COVID-19-related preparation delays. The order rejects longer delay requests from both the defense and prosecution.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose trial date is being adjourned. Her defense counsel requested a continuance to prepare for new charges in a superseding indictment.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, who grants a short continuance of Maxwell's trial to fall 2021 after considering arguments from both sides.

persons.name: Judge Furman
persons.context: A judge presiding over a separate criminal matter involving lawyers who are also involved in the Maxwell case. His adjournment of a trial date is noted as affecting scheduling conflicts.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell and issued this order regarding her trial schedule.

events.title: Government files S2 Superseding Indictment
events.description: The Government filed a superseding indictment (S2) adding new charges and extending the timeframe of alleged conspiracies, identifying a fourth alleged victim (Minor Victim-4).

events.title: Originally scheduled trial start date
events.description: The trial in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell was originally scheduled to commence on this date.

events.title: Deadline for parties to propose new trial date
events.description: The court orders the parties to meet, confer, and jointly propose a new trial start date by this deadline.

events.title: Court order granting continuance
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues an order granting a continuance of Maxwell's trial to fall 2021.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The S2 Superseding Indictment extended the timeframe of alleged conspiracies from through 1997 to 2004 and identified a fourth alleged victim, referred to as Minor Victim-4.
The S2 Indictment added two new charges: Count 5 (sex trafficking conspiracy 2001-2004) and Count 6 (sex trafficking of a minor or aiding and abetting).
The court granted a continuance of Maxwell's trial from July 12, 2021, to fall 2021, citing the burden of new charges and COVID-19-related preparation delays.
The court rejected longer continuance requests from both Maxwell's defense (until January 2022) and the Government (until March 2022).
The order notes that Maxwell is detained pre-trial and that the interests of victims and the public in a timely trial were considered.
